abstract: Beginning of new fall television season is bringing anxiety to advertisers as upfront market was weak in 2015; total ad revenue fell 10 percent for broadcast networks and 5 percent for cable; real-time viewing has declined, as audiences switch to streaming services or record shows to watch later; TV advertising is forecast to drop 3.5 percent in 2015 to $63.3 billion.
lead_paragraph: Traditional television might reach big audiences, but social media outlets like Facebook and Twitter can offer cheaper ways to connect with specific groups.

headline.main: Fall TV Season Opens Onto a Shifting Ad Landscape
headline.print_headline: Fall TV Season Arrives and Finds a Changed Ad Landscape

snippet: Traditional television might reach big audiences, but social media outlets like Facebook and Twitter can offer cheaper ways to connect with specific groups.
